text:
Update (March 6, 8:00 A.M.): With good humor, Emma Watson has acknowledged the grammar error in her temporary Time’s Up tattoo (or rather, “Times Up” tattoo). On Monday night the actress tweeted, “Fake tattoo proofreading position available. Experience with apostrophes a must.”

X content

The original story continues below.

If anyone had any doubts about Emma Watson’s commitment to the Time’s Up movement, behold her new ink. Watson debuted a tattoo on her inner arm at Monday Night’s Vanity Fair Oscar party, “Times Up” written in a large, cursive script.

It’s unclear whether this new addition is permanent or not (though Twitter seems to have agreed that it’s temporary, but there is one little grammatical problem she may want to go back and fix if so. The “Time’s Up” written on her arm is missing its very crucial apostrophe. Fortunately, it’s much easier to go back and add ink to tattoos than it is to remove it, temporary or not.

This wouldn’t be the first time Watson has psyched the world out with fake tattoos. While attending the Glastonbury music festival in 2010, she sported a temporary tattoo on her upper arm, two birds unraveling a scroll that read “mother lover.” For her role in 2013’s The Bling Ring, Watson had some faux ink on her lower back and even added some stars on her hip for a GQ cover that year.
title: Emma Watson Debuts Temporary Time’s Up Tattoo at the Vanity Fair Oscar Party
